intro: Phanera cunninghamii, commonly known as the Cunningham's phanera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with woody stems and palmate leaves. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and bloom during the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Phanera cunninghamii is often found in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in well-drained environments.
